meanings.definition: Not universal; not applying to or affecting all instances.
meanings.sent1: The rule was nonuniversal, so it only applied to some students.
meanings.sent2: Her opinion was nonuniversal, as not everyone agreed with her.
meanings.sent3: The nonuniversal rule about wearing hats indoors led to some funny situations.
meanings.sent4: His nonuniversal taste in music made him stand out from the crowd.
meanings.sent5: The nonuniversal decision to cancel the event left many disappointed.

meanings.definition: Not of, relating to, or characteristic of the universe.
meanings.sent1: The nonuniversal theory proposed that there are multiple universes.
meanings.sent2: The alien's language was nonuniversal and difficult to understand.
meanings.sent3: The nonuniversal concept of time travel in the movie confused the audience.
meanings.sent4: Her nonuniversal perspective on life made her seem like she was from another planet.
meanings.sent5: The nonuniversal laws of physics in the sci-fi novel created a fascinating world.
